description:
PSUP OMEGA mineral maps are OMEGA-based NIR albedo, Ferric BD530, Ferric Nanophase, Olivine SP1, SP2, SP3, Pyroxene and Emissivity at 5.03µm. OMEGA is the VISNIR imaging spectrometer onboard ESA/Mars-Express spacecraft operating around Mars from January 2004. All maps are provided in FITS file format via the "download" column.

This Dataset is also available as a VO TAP service (ivo://idoc/psup/omega_maps/q/epn_core).

sci:publications.citation: A. Ody, F. Poulet, Y. Langevin, J.-P. Bibring, G. Bellucci, F. Altieri, B. Gondet, M. Vincendon, J.Carter and N. Manaud (2012), Global maps of anhydrous minerals at the surface of Mars from OMEGA/MEx, J. Geophys. Res., 117, E00J14
M. Vincendon, J. Audouard, F. Altieri, A. Ody (2015), Mars Express measurements of surface albedo changes over 2004–2010, In Icarus, Volume 251, 2015, Pages 145-163, ISSN 0019-1035

J. Audouard, F. Poulet, M. Vincendon, J.-P. Bibring, F. Forget, Y. Langevin, B. Gondet (2014), Mars surface thermal inertia and heterogeneities from OMEGA/MEX, In Icarus Volume 233, 2014, Pages 194-213

F. Poulet, C. Quantin-Nataf, H. Ballans, K. Dassas, J. Audouard, J. Carter, B. Gondet, L. Lozac’h, J.-C. Malapert, C. Marmo, L. Riu, A. Séjourné (2018), PSUP: a Planetary SUrface Portal, Planetary and Space Science, Volume 150, 2018, Pages 2-8

providers.name: Institut d'Astrophysique Spatiale (IAS) - IDOC
providers.description:
The Integrated Data and Operation Center (IDOC) is responsible for processing, archiving
and distributing data from space science missions in which the IAS institute is involved.

providers.name: Géosciences Paris-Saclay (GEOPS)
providers.description:
GEOPS is a joint laboratory of the “Université de Paris-Sud” (UPSUD) and the "Centre National
de la Recherche Scientifique" (CNRS).

providers.name: Planetary SUrface Portal (PSUP)
providers.description:
PSUP is a french research service, by Observatoire Paris-Sud and Observatoire de Lyon, to help
the distribution of high added-value datasets of planetary surfaces.
